author: A_Brickset_user
title: Oh! Great set!
review: This is a great supplement for any western town, it got three soldiers ready to fight for or against you. Be carful, they got guns! I wish there were more "normal" soldiers, not so many officers.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: No Confederates!
review:
I like the Union army sets but I wish there was a confederate side to make a lego civil war! It obviously is a Union set with the General riding the steed, a sergeant with the bugel, and a regular infantry man with the rifle! I like the way of pointing the sword! 
It is a nice set but I would recommend larger sets!

author: mrmitch
title: Three men on Patrol
review: Western theme is still one of my all time favorite. This set was less than $8.00 US and considering what is in the set it was a bargin. Three cool mini figures, a horse a unique bugle, a flag and a black horse for the General to comand from. Goes great with other western theme sets a 5+ in my mind.

author: hustla187
title: good set
review: This is such a great set to make your frontier army. It comes with a general, horse, and two soldiers. The horn is very cool because it knows when war will strike. A must own for any Lego Western fan. Definitely a 5 out of 5.

author: Gus_263
title: This is a patrol, but helps to make an army
review: This is a small set, without many possibilities of building if you have few sets. This don't helps in buildings because this don't have one. But this is also an army builder, have three minifigures and a horse, without a expensive cost. Some pieces too are useful, like the bugle, flag and the dynamite, to make a lego scenery, and weapons, another thing to armies, like the sword of the pirates and shotguns. The body of the minifigures are blue, liking to each other, liking be repeated, but being again useful to armies.

author: Lego_in_the_Box
title: No Bad Guys Allowed!
review: These small sets are fairly decent. If you are building up armies from two set lines, then these are very good. This particular set gives you a horse, colonel, three guns(two rifles and a pistol), a bush, a flag, a horse and saddle, a cutlass, a bugle, two soldiers, and a brick of dynamite(you can never have too many of those). A decent set for a military builder, or if you want ammunition. A good idea is to make a battle.

author: Crazybrick45
title: Great battle pack type set
review: This is a good set if you need extra soldiers or guns. It comes with a flag, horse, bush, colonel, 2 soldiers, a bugle, stick of dynamite, a pistol, and 2 rifles. This is a very good set if you want to build an army. There should be a set like this except indians.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Western - Frontier Patrol
review:
The Frontier Patrol (6706) is a LEGO Western set which came out in 1997. It comes with 3 minifigs and 30 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no missing pieces in this set.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6706-1.jpg[/img]


Frontier Patrol:

The frontier patrol is a very nice army builder for your LEGO western cavalry. This set comes with 3 minifigs, a black horse with a brown saddle and some weapons. The weapons which comes with the set are 2 rifles, 1 revolver, 1 sword and 1 stick of dynamite. This set also has a flag and a trumpet.

The minifigs which we get are 2 cavalrymen and 1 lieutenant. The first calvaryman has a brown beard, a blue jacket with white suspender on it, blue pants, a blue hat and a white bandanna. The other cavalryman has a blue jacket, blue pants, a white bandanna, a blue cowboy hat and a dark gray beard.

The lieutenant has black pants, a blue jacket a blue cowboyhat with the cavalry logo and a black mustache. All three minifigs have white hands and they got a black belt which says 'US'. Just get this model if you want to get the minifigs, or want the pieces for some cool MOC's (my own creations) or if you want to build a cavalry army.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifigs
Nice starter set
No stickers
Nice addition to your LEGO Western collection

Negative:

No play features



All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: Darthleapyous
title: i like those soldiers!
review:
well, im not sure if i have this actual set... but i have all the right pieces (that are all broken apart in my lego box).my sisters had some lego before me and i'm sure they have this set. i think i do have this set! well, enough of all the remembering if i had this buiseness, lets get on with the review! 

 

 

i like the shiny trumpet piece i think they are rare.i really like the hats also (especially the one with the insignia).the trumpet is nice and the horse is awesome!i dont mind the old dynamite piece in it, because you can connect it on a brick.the rifles are a perfect feature of the set and finally the minifigures,i like them because there blue (on of my favorite colours) and the bandana is cool. overall a great set, if you want get it of ebay (because they dont sell it anymore)

author: Odeinoichus
title: Oh &**$ The Cavalry!
review:
Set #6706 Frontier Patrol: Ah LEGO Western Theme, what's not to love? Cowboys, Indians, Bandits, Black Hats, White Hats, United States Soldiers. And the wonderful new rifles and pistols that were first introduced in this era. (Alongside Adventurers of course.)

 

This is one of those Mini-Figures sets I mentioned in my review of Fright Force, it was fairly inexpensive back in the day and gave you three ranks of soldier, a horse, a fancy chromed bugle piece and guns, lots and lots of guns.

 

There isn't much to say about this set, the Mini-Figures are classic, the printing on their torsos stands out quite nicely in any mixed display of Mini-Figures and on the plus side you have some interesting head-gear for the trio. The leader on the Horse has a nice blue hat with embossed symbol denoting that he is the head honcho.

 

On the box the Bugler is given the blue cowboy style hat while the standard bearer is given the corporal's hat, this of course, like any LEGO set is swapped in the instructions if I recall. (I don't actually have mine anymore, but I always felt that the Corporal would be the bugler.)

 

Each of them is given a rifle, the Captain on horseback is also given a small pistol and 'pirate' sword. There is also the old-school printed plate dynamite. (Wouldn't it be neat if LEGO made a few new Western themed sets with the new Power Miners dynamite piece?)

 

I guess all I have left to say about this set is, it is definitely worth it to pick it up if you can find it for a good price. It's a cheap way to get some more Frontier Soldiers for your Fort LEGORedo display and you can't go wrong with the Western theme.
